title: Triangle Angle Sum Theorem
theorem: The sum of interior angles in any triangle equals 180°
given: Triangle ABC with angles α, β, γ

steps.content: Draw a line through vertex A parallel to side BC
By alternate interior angles, angle at A equals the angle formed by the parallel line and side AB
steps.note: Incorrect: alternate interior angles require a transversal, and the reasoning is imprecise

steps.content: Similarly, the angle at A also equals the angle formed with side AC
steps.note: This contradicts step 2 - cannot have two different equalities for the same angle

steps.content: Since the parallel line creates a straight angle (180°), we have α + β + γ = 180°
steps.note: The conclusion is correct but the proof chain is flawed
